I've hosted a small kitchen table event, 'Hack it!' and it was just awesome! It is simple and yet more productive. We were 5 people including two children who are below 15 years of age.

It was a 45 minute event. I gave an overview for 10 minutes on using Hackasaurus X-ray goggles to inspect the code and remix a webpage and the children started hacking their way. Now, it became a hobby for them to remix websites using all their creativity.


Below are the links to some of the hacks we did!
 
http://poof.hksr.us/etmpehwb
http://poof.hksr.us/zcfenyus
http://cmon.lovebomb.me/hitoftuo
http://cmon.lovebomb.me/fyhmabeu

Now start hosting your own Kitchen Table events. It just needs a couple of enthusiastic guys, 20 minutes and a table! :)

Here is the simple guide on hosting a Kitchen Table event.
